meanings.definition: To be constantly or visibly worried or anxious.
meanings.sent1: She would fret about her upcoming test all night.
meanings.sent2: Don't fret too much about the little things.
meanings.sent3: Even though it was just a game, he would fret over losing.
meanings.sent4: Her mind would constantly fret over what could go wrong.
meanings.sent5: The image of her failing would always make her fret.

meanings.definition: A small groove or ridge cut into a material.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter carefully carved a fret into the wood.
meanings.sent2: The intricate design featured delicate frets along the edges.
meanings.sent3: The artist added a unique twist by incorporating a colorful fret.
meanings.sent4: The fret in the metal added a touch of elegance to the sculpture.
meanings.sent5: The fret along the border gave the piece a beautiful finish.

meanings.definition: A metal bar fixed across the fingerboard of a guitar or similar instrument to produce notes of different pitches.
meanings.sent1: The musician adjusted the fret on his guitar for the perfect sound.
meanings.sent2: He slid his fingers along the fret to play different notes.
meanings.sent3: The worn-out fret on the guitar gave it a vintage look.
meanings.sent4: The guitarist's fingers danced effortlessly on the frets.
meanings.sent5: The shiny fret gleamed under the stage lights.
